The role is fast-moving and varied, with plenty of opportunities to constantly improve, add to and change existing processes. Candidates can expect to work with: MS SQL (lots), Python, C#, F#, Kafka, Pandas, Jupyter, PowerShell, OpenShift, ElasticSearch and more.SkillsIntegrating and preparing large, varied datasets and creating generic processes for consuming, analysing and communicating the results of the data.Working closely with stakeholders across the firm to turn data into critical information and knowledge that can be used to make sound decisions.Digging into and exploring data; identifying features and issues, and communicating them to others in a clear and concise way.Automating and improving processes; taking responsibility for data quality, monitoring, and anomaly detection.Designing, building and deploying tools used across the business and owning the projects end-to-end.The right candidate will have technical skills focusing on the following key areas.RequiredA solid understanding of Computer Science fundamentals; knowledge of data structures and algorithms and how they can be applied.Extensive experience querying, ingesting and manipulating large volumes of data using SQL.Strong programming skills in any major Object Oriented language (C# preferred) and any other language(s) (Python, PowerShell preferred).A degree in Computer Science/Engineering and at least two years of commercial experience.PreferredKnowledge and understanding of web technologies.Familiarity with data visualisation tools.Comfortable developing across multiple platforms.Experience with Apache Kafka or similar stream processing platforms.Experience working with a variety of data storage and manipulation tools such as Pandas, Jupyter, ElasticSearch & Kibana.HFDEHK1

KaiOS Technologies powers an ecosystem of affordable digital products and services, and exists to empower people around the world through technology. Its flagship product, KaiOS, is the leading mobile operating system for smart feature phones with more than 100 million devices shipped in over 100 countries. KaiOS is based on HTML5 and other open web technologies. Devices running on the platform require limited memory, while still offering a rich user experience through access to apps like the Google Assistant, YouTube, Facebook, Google Maps, and Twitter.Kais mission is to open up new possibilities for individuals, organizations, and society by bringing mobile connectivity to the billions of people without internet in emerging markets, as well as providing those in established markets with an alternative to smartphones. To make this happen, Kai partners with leading ODM/OEMs and carriers, such as ATT, Sprint, T-Mobile, Orange, MTN, China Mobile, HMD, Doro, and Bullitt. Kai is also backed by major technology and telecom industry players, including Google, Reliance Jio and TCL. Together with these partners, Kai focuses on creating affordable devices and data plans that make internet access a reality for everyone, while simultaneously helping partners transform their business models.KaiOS is a mobile operating system for smart feature phones that stormed the scene to become the 3rd largest mobile OS globally (2nd in India ahead of iOS). We are on 100M+ devices in 100+ countries. We recently closed a Series B round with Cathay Innovation, Google and TCL.We are looking for an experienced big data engineer for our Hong Kong-based data technology team to work as part of an agile team alongside data scientists, data analysts, software and DevOps engineers. The team is in charge of all data products and data infrastructure at KaiOS. Much of our data is event-based from a variety of rich data streams, such as Kai app store and our own real-time advertising tech stack (built by another Hong Kong-based team under the same roof). We strive to distill the data trail from millions of users interactions with our platform into a progressively enhanced and robust analytical picture in the key areas of business. We also build and operate data and machine learning-powered APIs.What we are looking for:Breadth and depth of knowledge and experience with data technology at scaleExtensive experience with a variety of databases, including modern non-relational data technology and understanding of underlying design choices, trade-offs, sweet spots and internal workingsExperience building scalable and reliabledata pipelinesKnowledge of data formats and associated tradeoffsExperience with streaming data processing a plusExtensive experience with test automation, CI / CDExtensive experience with modern version control systems, such as GitExperience designing and developing REST or GraphQL APIs a plusExperience working in cross-functional delivery-focused agile teamsExtensive experience with iterative developmentOutstanding analytical thinking, problem solving skills and attention to detailExcellent verbal and written communication skillsRequirements:Engineering background and academic qualificationsFluency in Python or Scala; shell scripting; Golang a plusIn-depth knowledge and fluency with SQLExperience with data modelingExtensive experience with AWS, including services such as EMR/Spark, Kinesis, RedShift, RDS, DynamoDB, Athena, Glue, Lambda, CloudWatch, IAM, etc. Infrastructure tooling and automation a plus.We offer attractive salary and fringe benefit. Interested parties please apply with your full resume stating present and expected salary to Human Resources Manager via email by clicking "Apply Now".For more information, please visit our website at www.kaiostech.com/All information provided will be treated in strict confidence and used solely for recruitment purposes.Full-time,Permanent

JobTitle: CIB QR â€“ Quantitative Research AAO (Analytics, Automation & Optimization), Systematic Trading, Executive Director
JobDescription: Who We Are:JPMorgan Chase & Co. (NYSE: JPM) is a leading global financial services firm with assets of $2.7 trillion and operations worldwide. The firm is a leader in investment banking, financial services for consumers and small business, commercial banking, financial transaction processing, and asset management. A component of the Dow Jones Industrial Average, JPMorgan Chase & Co. serves millions of consumers in the United States and many of the world's most prominent corporate, institutional and government clients under its J.P. Morgan and Chase brands. Information about JPMorgan Chase & Co. is available at www.jpmorganchase.com.What it Means To Work Here:Here, you'll feel welcomed and valued. Our clients, transactions, deals and projects are global so we work hard to create diverse, inclusive teams that support our business and each other. Learn about our culture at https://careers.jpmorgan.com/global/en/about-usThe role of the QR Systematic Trading group is to identify opportunities to transform, automate and optimize our trading operations and to define and implement cutting-edge next generation analytics to support this business transformation. We cover all equities businesses and work closely with traders to develop data-driven solutions such as algorithmic strategies (high to low frequency), trading signals, risk models, portfolio optimization, flow categorization and clustering â€“ and to combine them into automated trading processes or trading algorithms.We are looking for a strong and experienced candidate to support primarily the APAC Delta 1 and Internal Market Making desks. Communication skills and drive are critical for this role as we expect the candidate to actively engage with the business and act as a culture carrier for modern data-driven methods and business automation.Responsibilities:Build trading analytics and algorithmic trading strategies such as portfolio optimization, index arbitrage, statistical arbitrage and market making strategies (on Equity cash, Futures, ETFs) for the Delta One and Cash trading desks.Identify business opportunities and contribute to the entire lifecycle from idea generation to production: perform research, design prototype, implement analytics and strategies, monitor daily usage and analyze performanceSupport trading activity by investigating model and algorithm behavior (scenarios and post trade analysis, historical behavior)Devise hedging and trading strategies and build execution logicQualifications:PhD or Masterâ€™s Degree in a quantitative discipline from a top-tier institutionAt least seven years of relevant quant experience in systematic quantitative trading in Equity or related asset classesStrong written and verbal communication skills, ability to convey the ideas behind complex research in a clear and precise mannerA thorough understanding of algorithmic trading, market making, index and statistical arbitrageGood expertise in statistical modelling & optimization, including standard models, linear, convex & conic optimization)A strong coding background with proficiency in C++, Python and relevant quantitative packages (numpy, pandas). Ability to manipulate and analyze complex, large scale, high-dimensionality data from multiple sources. Knowledge of KDB/Q expected.Knowledge of derivatives pricing and risk management theory (vanilla options and volatility products) is a plusDiversity StatementWe recognize that our people are our strength and the diverse talents they bring to our global workforce is directly linked to our success. We are an equal opportunity employer and place a high value on diversity and inclusion at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of any protected attribute, including race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital or veteran status, or disability, or any other basis protected under applicable local law. In accordance with applicable local law, we make reasonable accommodations for applicantsâ€™ and employeesâ€™ religious practices and beliefs, as well as any mental health or physical disability needs.

Created in 2006, Ekimetrics is a global consultancy, pioneer & leader in Data ScienceWith +280 Data Scientists, all consultants, worldwide (Paris, London, NY, Hong Kong and Dubai), we lead projects in 50+ countries, in various industries (automotive, luxury, FMCG, retail, etc.).Our mission is to help companies build new world-class data and analytics capabilities, which enables our clients to power-up their revenue strategy or business model thanks to data.Our difference lies in an integrated approach to performance, and in the desire to reaffirm the value of understanding the business lines, which we believe is at the heart of transforming data into new business assets.Key figures:Â· 13 years of experience in Data ScienceÂ· +300 consultants, all are also data scientistsÂ· 5 offices in Paris, London, New York, Hong Kong & DubaiÂ· +350 clients (CAC40 & Fortune500)Â· +1Bn profit generated for our clients since our creationJob responsibilitiesThe DOT (Data and Operations Team) is the team within Ekimetrics that works on data architectures, data engineering and industrialization of data science projects.The team is comprised of 20 people in Ekimetrics Paris office and, as the team grows, we are looking for a Lead Data Engineer in Ekimetrics Hong Kong office.As Lead Data Engineer, you will be leading challenging projects with international blue-chip clients across diverse industries, building bespoke analytics solutions to answer the key questions and consulting on the findings, including high-profile presentations to senior clients. You will be working in teams, comprising Data Science Consultants and other Data Engineers, on 2 to 3 projects simultaneously.Â· The primary focus of the Lead Data Engineer will be to work on the industrialization dimension of data projects, from advisory to project management, with customers interactions ranging from technical teams to CIOs. He/she will drive high client value and broaden relationships at the most senior levels with current and prospective clients and translate this into new business opportunities for Ekimetrics.Â· The Lead Data Engineer will drive projects from the initialization meetings all the way to final recommendations, responsible for analysing business requirements, translating into strategic architecture and organizational recommendations and implementing projects within the set architecture and governance.Â· The successful candidate will develop skills of more junior team members, for them to have stronger impact on work across core areas of the clientsâ€™ businesses.Â· Finally, the successful candidate will support the business development initiatives and thought-leadership, transfer knowledge to junior team members, and continue to build Ekimetrics reputation and brand in Asia.1. Data ArchitectureÂ· Work on assessments, strategy and architecture recommendationsÂ· Participate in the definition of the projects and the roadmaps, identify actions to improve engagementsÂ· Present actionable and easy-to-understand findings to drive high levels of adoption within client organizations2. Team ManagementÂ· Work with the Paris DOT teams to share projects and practices,Â· Contribute to the recruitment of Data Engineers to assemble the Hong Kong DOT teamÂ· Manage the team as it will grow (with the help of vendors if necessary)Â· Retain top performers and support the development of future Eki leadersÂ· Provide visible sponsorship to recruiting, retaining & engaging diverse talent in your organization3. Business ManagementÂ· Design and scope new projects, using the right analyses to answer client questionsÂ· Participate in pre-sales of DOT projects in Asia,Â· Deliver with excellence â€“ ensure high client satisfaction and make sure that issues are raised and resolved in a timely manner with no surprisesÂ· Ensure client's business case is achievable and Ekimetrics has appropriate ability to influence promised outcomesÂ· Drive client retention and new business opportunities4. Ekimetrics LifeÂ· Help lead our fast growth by contributing to local and global initiatives such as Thought-Leadership, Knowledge Management, Recruitment, Culture, Gender Balance and Diversity teams, Data Engineering/Architecture techniques for the office, etc.Candidateâ€™s profileQualificationsThe successful candidate will have a minimum of 8-10 years in data architecture, with expertise in both BI and Big Data architectures, either on-prem or in the Cloud. While working closely with the other members of the DOT, he/she will need to be autonomous enough to initiate the DOT team in the Hong Kong office.The successful candidate will also have a balance of business strategy understanding, client-facing consulting experience, and significant data and analytics expertise. The work will be rooted in the creation of innovative analytic engagements for clients.Technical skillsÂ· A Ph.D. or Master's degree in a quantitative discipline such as computer science, statistics, applied mathematics from a leading academic institution is preferredÂ· 8+ years of experience in Data Analysis / Data Architectures / DWH / Data Lakes in a business setting, preferably in a client-facing consulting-oriented roleÂ· Passion for data, extensive knowledge in statistics or applied mathematics, experience with techniques such as Machine LearningÂ· Expertise in key technologies related to Data Management:o SQL, Spark, Python,o Cloud platforms (Azure, GCP, AWS, etc.)Â· Expertise in some aspects of Data Management and readiness to grow in the others:o Data analytics architectureso Data governance processes and platformso Data ingestion & transformation in data-warehouses or data-lakeso Data visualizationTransversal skillsÂ· Excellent communication skills â€“ especially translating complex technical findings into plain language insights and stories for stakeholdersÂ· Demonstrated ability to develop new and lasting client relationships at senior levels across multiple industriesÂ· Team oriented and collaborative working style, both with clients and within EkimetricsÂ· Management experience and demonstrated ability to develop younger talent and build a high performing team.Â· Project management and delivery expertiseÂ· Passion for joining a small team and desire to help the business grow quicklyWhat we offerÂ· Competitive package for a Lead Data Engineer in a management consultancy business in Hong KongÂ· Challenging and diverse missions with international blue-chip clients across Asia.Â· Creative and entrepreneurial start-up environment with vertical mobilityÂ· Unique training programÂ· Growth to develop a double profile in data science and strategic consultingÂ· Client exposure up to the executive levelÂ· KaiOS Technologies powers an ecosystem of affordable digital products and services, and exists to empower people around the world through technology. Its flagship product, KaiOS, is the leading mobile operating system for smart feature phones with more than 120 million devices shipped in over 100 countries. Kais mission is to open up new possibilities for individuals, organizations, and societies by bringing mobile connectivity to the billions of people without internet in emerging markets, as well as providing those in established markets with an alternative to smartphones. KaiOS is based on HTML5 and other open web technologies. Devices running on the platform require limited memory, while still offering a rich user experience through access to apps like the Google Assistant, WhatsApp, YouTube, Facebook, and Google Maps.KaiOS is a Mobile Operating System for Smart Feature Phones that stormed the scene to become the 3rd largest mobile OS globally (2nd in India ahead of iOS). We are on 100M+ devices in 100+ countries. We recently closed a Series B round with Cathay Innovation, Google and TCL.We are looking for a Project Manager for our Hong Kong-based data team to work alongside Data Engineers, Data Analysts, Data Scientists, Machine Learning Engineers and DevOps Engineers. The Data team at KaiOS is in charge of everything that is driven by the vast and varied datasets produced by our platform and ecosystem - insight / analytics, data APIs and machine learning models and at-scale data systems to support it all.Broad classes of things the team works on:Data feeds, reports, dashboards, metrics KPIs for varied internal and external constituenciesDistillation of high-grade datasets that enable data science and machine learningDevelopment, productization and refinement of machine learning modelsAPIs powered by this data and modelsInitiatives to support data quality and completenessYour core activities would be:Unpacking underlying value in data-related requests originating from various constituencies, prioritizing and breaking down the workMaintaining the team backlog and ensuring end-to-end deliveryWorking tirelessly to remove obstacles in the teams pathCoordinating with other teams across KaiOSWhat we are looking for:Engineering background and Academic QualificationsOutstanding analytical thinking, organizational skills and attention to detail to understand designs, dependencies, challenges and risks in order to ensure timely and reliable deliveryExtensive experience in data-centric environmentsExperience working in cross-functional delivery-focused agile teamsExperience with iterative development across multiple work streamsAt least 5 years of experience in dealing with data driven productsExcellent written and verbal communication skillsWe offer attractive salary and fringe benefit. Interested parties please apply with your full resume stating present and expected salary to Human Resources Manager via email by clicking "Apply Now".For more information, please visit our website at www.kaiostech.com/All information provided will be treated in strict confidence and used solely for recruitment purposes.Full-time,Permanent

JobTitle: Computational Biologist (in the grade/rank of Senior Research Assistant / Senior Technical Officer) (several posts)
JobDescription: Ref.: 499994Work type: Full-timeDepartment: Centre for PanorOmic Sciences (22200)Categories: Research Support Staff, Executive / Technical / SupportHong KongComputational Biologist (in the grade/rank of Senior Research Assistant / Senior Technical Officer) (several posts) in the Centre for PanorOmic Sciences (Ref.: 499994) (to commence as soon as possible, on a two-year fixed-term basis with contract-end gratuity and University contribution to a retirement benefits scheme, totalling up to 10% of basic salary, with the possibility of renewal subject to satisfactory performance)We are seeking for talented computational scientists with backgrounds in mass spectrometry, metabolomics, proteomics or informatics, to join our bioinformatics team.Applicants should have a Ph.D. degree in Computer Science, Bioinformatics, Biological Sciences, or a related discipline, with at least 3 yearsâ€™ hands-on bioinformatics analysis experience; and possess the ability to use programming languages such as R, Python, Perl, Java, or related languages. Experience in analyzing multi-omics datasets or writing workflows will be desirable. Applicants should possess excellent communication skills; have a strong interest in working closely with investigators; and be highly motivated, independent, and able to perform in a multidisciplinary team environment, whilst working and managing multiple projects in parallel. Applicants with less experience/qualifications but with a good initiative will also be considered.The appointees will have the unique opportunity to participate in world-class research, work with clinicians, biologists and bioinformatics experts, and expose to a wide range of applications. They will apply the latest analytics tools to multi-omics data, evaluate and establish analysis pipelines, lead and provide supervision of junior staff members. Those who have responded to the previous advertisement (Ref.: 499734) need not re-apply.A highly competitive salary commensurate with qualifications and experience will be offered, in addition to annual leave and medical benefits.The University only accepts online application for the above posts. Applicants should apply online and upload an up-to-date C.V. Review of applications will start as soon as possible and continue until May 17, 2020, or until the posts are filled, whichever is earlier.Advertised:Apr 16, 2020 (HK Time)Applications close:May 17, 2020 (HK Time)

Our OpportunityWe offer a full range of tailored and focused solutions to help our customers feel confident about their future and meet their financial planning goals by offering leading life insurance, investment and protection solutions. To meet with the needs of business expansion, we are seeking for a passionate and experienced Data Analyst to participate in the build-out of our Data Analytic and Visualization capability. If you are interested in working in a dynamic, challenging environment, for a company that recognizes and rewards your creativity, initiative and contributions, just simply click "Apply online".Your RoleSupport to design and build the datawarehouse/datamart models, a centralized repository of integrated data from various data sources and required components, such as ETL processes, reports and dashboardsDesign and create end-to-end ETL processes utilizing tools such as MS SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS), SSAS or othersUtilize Microsoft Power BI and SQL Server Reporting Services in designing and building reports and dashboardsDefine and create business datamarts/datasets, measures, KPIs and dashboards to empower data analytic capability across functional teams for Life BusinessStudy and understand the company's business processes and applications, including their effect on data and reporting, and applies the knowledge gained in designing datasets, reports and dashboardsIdentify and document all requirements for components, dashboards and reports by working with IT and SMEsPrepare test plan, test cases/scripts, perform testing and user trainingAssemble performance statistics, analyze them and make recommendations for improvementsEstablish data dictionary and other related documentationYour Skills and ExperienceBachelor degree with 5 years of relevant experience in Business/Requirement Analysis, Data Transformation & Visualization, preferably in insurance industryKnowledge of insurance products, operations, policy admin system, would be an advantageExperience in data mapping, ETL process, data-modeling and reporting/dashboard functionsExperience in using Microsoft Azure, Microsoft SQL Server, SSIS, SSRS/PowerBIGood analytical and problem solving skillsGood communication skills and able to articulate business processes/requirements to all levelsProficiency in both written and spoken English and ChineseAdditional InformationPrimary work location is Hong Kong. You can apply by clicking on the button â€œApply onlineâ€ùWho we areLooking for a career that will excite, challenge and inspire you? Thinking about insurance? Perhaps you should. Working for us is a totally different experience to what you probably expect. How do you feel about the things you truly love? Donâ€™t you want to protect them in the best way possible? Imagine if you could help people do this all over the world. Youâ€™d give them confidence and reassurance by protecting what they love most. This is no easy task. In todayâ€™s interconnected world, tackling risk is fast, unpredictable and invigorating. Youâ€™ll have to think on your feet as you manage risks big and small, from flooding to cyber crime. Youâ€™ll be tackling issues like these in over 170 countries. Itâ€™s a big challenge, but youâ€™ll have a truly diverse network helping you. As part of an international team, every day would provide opportunities to learn, grow and share ideas.As you make an impact across borders, youâ€™ll feel the support of being part of a strong and stable company. A long-standing player in the insurance industry, we make every effort to address the career development needs and plans of our employees to ensure their success in the future.So make a difference. Be challenged. Be inspired. Be supported, Love what you do. Work for us.Zurich Insurance has the policy to be an equal opportunity employer. We aim to attract and retain the best qualified individuals available, without regard to criteria such as race/ethnicity, national origin, religion, gender, sexual orientation, age or disability.At Zurich we believe that having a culture of inclusion is essential in delivering good results. Attracting, retaining and developing a diverse workforce where employees feel valued, respected and empowered allows people to reach their full potential. As a business this diversity helps us to better reflect and understand our 4 million customersâ€™ needs to allow us to drive better outcomes. As a global organisation, with an increasingly agile workforce, we're happy to consider flexible working arrangements.Primary Location Hong KongSchedule Full-timeTravel NoJob Posting 12/03/19Unposting Date Ongoing

JobTitle: Assistant Charities Manager / Charities Support Manager (Data Analyst)
JobDescription: The DepartmentFounded in 1884, The Hong Kong Jockey Club has become one of Hong Kongâ€™s best known and respected organisations, providing the public with world-class sporting entertainment as well as being the cityâ€™s major non-Government community benefactor. Our contribution to the community is made possible through our unique, not-for-profit business model that channels the surplus proceeds from responsible gaming into community benefits. The Club is now donating over HK$3.6 billion a year to charitable and community projects through its Charities Trust. The Charities Department provides support to the Board of Trustees in the task of granting donations to various non-profit organizations in support of community projects, including arts and culture, sports and recreation, youth services, elderly services, environmental protection, medical and health, etc.The JobYou will:Manage and analyse data related to Charities projects and operations. Maintain and update databases and ensure data quality, reliability, and timelinessGenerate insights from data to inform Charities project monitoring, evaluation and learning, and grant-makingDevelop and update regular reports and dashboards to facilitate data-driven decision-makingCoordinate with various teams to gather user requirement for reporting and data analyticsSupport strategic research projects, carried out internally or in collaboration with external researchersCarry out other activities as necessary, including ah-hoc research, creating presentation and training materials, writing reports, planning and execution of stakeholder engagement activities, etc.About YouYou should have:a good university degree, with at least 4 years of relevant experience, preferably in data analytics, statistics, IT, and/or quantitative research fieldshigh proficiency with MS Excel and Powerpoint skills. Knowledge of statistical tools preferred.excellent analytical and project management skillsexcellent communication skills (including spoken and written English and Chinese ability)excellent collaboration and team-work skillsPassion for, and demonstrated commitment to, improving the Hong Kong communityTerms of EmploymentThe level of appointment will be commensurate with qualifications and experience. A contract employment will be offered to the successful candidate. Contract renewal will be subject to mutual agreement between the Club and the individual.Closing DateOnly shortlisted candidates will be notified.

Candidates who are familiar with tableau or SAP Business Object will definitely be an advantage.Responsibilities:Perform data collection, validation and consolidation.Able to communicate with corresponding parties such as our Business Units.Support data mining and analysis project.Collect and define requirement from business user and able to coordinate our projects.Perform any ad-hoc reporting and analysis task as necessary.Support and design interactive dashboards using tableau or with vendors.Knowledge in Business Intelligence production with tool such as SAP Business Object.Qualifications:Degree in Math, Statistics, Business or related disciplinesAt least 5 years relevant experience in business analysis or retail industryCreative, detail-minded and work independentlyProficiency in MS Office including Excel, PowerPoint, or other reporting toolsSQL experience would be an advantageGood communication, presentation and interpersonal skillGood command of written and spoken English and ChineseLocationWatson House, 1-5 Wo Liu Hang Road, Fo Tan, Shatin NT Hong Kong
